articles.title: Add your first loyalty card
articles.description: Learn how to scan or manually add loyalty cards to your wallet.
articles.intro: Adding loyalty cards to Pocketz is quick and easy. You can either scan the barcode directly or enter the card details manually.

sections.heading: Scan a barcode
sections.content: To scan a loyalty card, tap the + button in the top right corner and select Scan Barcode. Point your camera at the barcode on your physical card. Pocketz will automatically detect and save the barcode.

sections.heading: Manual entry
sections.content: If scanning doesn't work, you can manually enter the card number. Tap Enter Manually and type in the number found below the barcode on your card.

sections.heading: Customize your card
sections.content: After adding a card, you can customize it by adding a name, choosing a color, or adding the store logo. Tap on the card and select Edit to make changes.

articles.title: Organize your cards
articles.description: Create folders, reorder cards, and keep your wallet tidy.
articles.intro: Keep your loyalty cards organized so you can find them quickly at checkout.

sections.heading: Create folders
sections.content: Group related cards into folders. Long-press on a card and select Move to Folder. You can create folders like "Groceries", "Fashion", or "Restaurants".

sections.heading: Reorder cards
sections.content: Drag and drop cards to reorder them. Your most-used cards can be placed at the top for quick access.

sections.heading: Favorites
sections.content: Mark frequently used cards as favorites by tapping the star icon. Favorite cards appear in a special section at the top of your wallet.

articles.title: Use cards at checkout
articles.description: How to show your barcode to the cashier for scanning.
articles.intro: Using your digital loyalty cards at the store is even easier than carrying physical cards.

sections.heading: Display your barcode
sections.content: Tap on a card to open it in full screen. The barcode will be displayed large and clear for the cashier to scan.

sections.heading: Brightness boost
sections.content: Pocketz automatically increases your screen brightness when displaying a barcode, making it easier to scan even in bright store lighting.

sections.heading: Works offline
sections.content: All your cards are stored locally on your device. You can access and use them even without an internet connection.

articles.title: Supported barcode types
articles.description: Learn which barcode formats Pocketz can read and display.
articles.intro: Pocketz supports all common barcode formats used by loyalty programs worldwide.

sections.heading: Supported formats
sections.content: Pocketz can read and display the following barcode types:

sections.heading: Automatic detection
sections.content: When you scan a barcode, Pocketz automatically detects the format and stores it correctly. You don't need to know the barcode type.

articles.title: Troubleshooting scan issues
articles.description: What to do when a barcode won't scan properly.
articles.intro: Having trouble scanning a barcode? Here are some tips to help.

sections.heading: Improve scanning conditions
sections.content: Make sure the barcode is well-lit and your camera lens is clean. Hold your phone steady about 6-8 inches from the barcode.

sections.heading: Try different angles
sections.content: If the barcode is reflective or on a curved surface, try tilting your phone slightly to reduce glare.

sections.heading: Use manual entry
sections.content: If scanning continues to fail, you can always enter the card number manually. The number is usually printed below the barcode.

articles.title: Edit card details
articles.description: Change the name, color, or barcode of an existing card.
articles.intro: Customize your cards to make them easier to identify and use.

sections.heading: Edit card information
sections.content: Tap on a card, then tap the Edit button (pencil icon) in the top right. You can change the card name, store name, and notes.

sections.heading: Change card color
sections.content: In edit mode, tap on the color picker to choose a new background color for your card. Match it to the store's branding for easy recognition.

sections.heading: Update barcode
sections.content: If you received a new card with a different barcode, tap Re-scan Barcode to update it.

articles.title: Share a card with someone
articles.description: Send a copy of your loyalty card to family or friends.
articles.intro: Easily share your loyalty cards with family members so everyone can earn points on the same account.

sections.heading: Share a card
sections.content: Tap on a card, then tap the Share button. Choose how you want to share: AirDrop, Messages, Email, or generate a QR code.

sections.heading: QR code sharing
sections.content: The recipient can scan the QR code with their Pocketz app to instantly add the card to their wallet.

sections.heading: Privacy note
sections.content: When you share a card, only the barcode and card name are shared. No personal account information is transmitted.

articles.title: Family sharing setup
articles.description: Set up automatic card sharing with family members.
articles.intro: With Family Sharing, all household members can access shared loyalty cards automatically.

sections.heading: Enable Family Sharing
sections.content: Go to Settings → Family Sharing and tap Set Up Family Sharing. Invite family members using their email or phone number.

sections.heading: Choose cards to share
sections.content: After setting up, you can choose which cards to share with the family. Shared cards appear with a family icon.

sections.heading: Manage permissions
sections.content: As the family organizer, you can control who can add new shared cards and who can only use existing ones.

articles.title: Add widgets to your Home Screen
articles.description: Access your favorite cards with a single tap.
articles.intro: Pocketz widgets let you access your most-used loyalty cards directly from your Home Screen.

sections.heading: Add a widget
sections.content: Long-press on your Home Screen and tap the + button in the top corner. Search for "Pocketz" and choose your preferred widget size.

sections.heading: Widget sizes
sections.content: Pocketz offers small (single card), medium (up to 3 cards), and large (up to 6 cards) widgets. Choose based on how many quick-access cards you need.

sections.heading: Configure widget
sections.content: After adding, long-press the widget and select Edit Widget to choose which cards to display.

articles.title: Lock Screen widgets
articles.description: Show a card on your Lock Screen for instant access.
articles.intro: With iOS 16 and later, you can add Pocketz widgets to your Lock Screen.

sections.heading: Add Lock Screen widget
sections.content: Long-press your Lock Screen, tap Customize, and add a Pocketz widget to the widget area below the time.

sections.heading: Quick launch
sections.content: Tapping the Lock Screen widget opens Pocketz directly to that card, ready for scanning.

articles.title: Pocketz on Apple Watch
articles.description: Access your cards from your wrist.
articles.intro: The Pocketz Apple Watch app lets you show barcodes right on your wrist.

sections.heading: Install on Apple Watch
sections.content: Open the Watch app on your iPhone, scroll to Pocketz, and tap Install.

sections.heading: Sync cards
sections.content: Your cards automatically sync to your Apple Watch. You can choose which cards to sync in the Pocketz settings.

sections.heading: Use at checkout
sections.content: Open Pocketz on your watch, select a card, and hold your wrist up to the scanner. The watch screen is bright enough for most scanners.

articles.title: How we protect your data
articles.intro: Your privacy is our top priority. Pocketz is designed to keep your data safe and private.

sections.heading: Local storage
sections.content: All your loyalty cards are stored locally on your device. We don't upload your card data to any servers.

sections.heading: No tracking
sections.content: Pocketz doesn't track your location, purchases, or store visits. We don't sell your data to anyone.

sections.heading: iCloud sync
sections.content: If you enable iCloud sync, your cards are encrypted and synced through your personal iCloud account. Only you can access them.

articles.title: Protect app with Face ID
articles.description: Add an extra layer of security with biometric authentication.
articles.intro: Lock Pocketz with Face ID or Touch ID to prevent unauthorized access.

sections.heading: Enable Face ID
sections.content: Go to Settings → Security and toggle on Require Face ID. You'll need to authenticate each time you open the app.

sections.heading: App Lock timeout
sections.content: Choose how quickly the app locks: immediately, after 1 minute, or after 5 minutes of inactivity.

articles.title: Backup and restore cards
articles.description: Never lose your cards when switching devices.
articles.intro: Keep your loyalty cards safe with automatic backups.

sections.heading: iCloud Backup
sections.content: Enable iCloud Sync in settings to automatically backup your cards. They'll be restored when you sign in on a new device.

sections.heading: Manual export
sections.content: You can also export your cards as a backup file. Go to Settings → Export Data to create a backup.

sections.heading: Restore from backup
sections.content: To restore, go to Settings → Import Data and select your backup file.

articles.title: Barcode won't scan at checkout
articles.description: What to do when the store scanner can't read your barcode.
articles.intro: Sometimes store scanners have trouble reading screen-displayed barcodes. Here's how to fix it.

sections.heading: Increase screen brightness
sections.content: Tap the brightness icon in Pocketz to maximize your screen brightness. This usually solves most scanning issues.

sections.heading: Clean your screen
sections.content: Smudges and fingerprints can interfere with barcode scanning. Wipe your screen clean before presenting it.

sections.heading: Hold steady
sections.content: Keep your phone still and at the right distance from the scanner (usually 3-6 inches).

sections.heading: Try manual entry
sections.content: If scanning still fails, ask the cashier to manually enter the card number. You can tap "Show Number" in Pocketz to display it.

articles.title: Cards not syncing between devices
articles.intro: If your cards aren't appearing on all your devices, try these steps.

sections.heading: Check iCloud status
sections.content: Go to Settings → Apple ID → iCloud and make sure Pocketz is enabled for iCloud.

sections.heading: Same Apple ID
sections.content: Ensure all devices are signed in with the same Apple ID.

sections.heading: Force sync
sections.content: In Pocketz settings, tap Sync Now to manually trigger a sync.

sections.heading: Check internet connection
sections.content: iCloud sync requires an internet connection. Make sure you're connected to Wi-Fi or cellular data.

articles.title: App crashes or freezes
articles.description: Steps to resolve app stability issues.
articles.intro: If Pocketz is crashing or freezing, try these troubleshooting steps.

sections.heading: Force quit and restart
sections.content: Swipe up from the bottom of your screen (or double-click the home button), then swipe away Pocketz. Reopen the app.

sections.heading: Update the app
sections.content: Make sure you have the latest version of Pocketz. Open the App Store and check for updates.

sections.heading: Restart your device
sections.content: Sometimes a device restart can fix persistent issues. Turn your iPhone off and back on.

sections.heading: Contact support
sections.content: If the issue persists, contact us at support@pocketz.app with details about what happened.

articles.title: Accidentally deleted a card
articles.description: How to recover a deleted loyalty card.
articles.intro: Don't worry! Deleted cards can often be recovered.

sections.heading: Recently Deleted
sections.content: Pocketz keeps deleted cards for 30 days. Go to Settings → Recently Deleted to recover them.

sections.heading: iCloud backup
sections.content: If you have iCloud sync enabled, your cards may be recoverable from your iCloud backup.

sections.heading: Re-scan the card
sections.content: If you still have the physical card, you can always scan it again to add it back.
